question: According to Karl Max, socialism developed as a consequence of the evils of ________
In the United States of America, legislature is called the
explanation: The United States Congress is the bicameral legislature of the federal government of the United States, and consists of two chambers: the House of Representatives and the Senate.

question: Which of the following agents can be considered as the most effective agent of political socialization? The _______
explanation:
The following agents of Socialization influence to different degrees an individual's political opinions:

  • Family.
  • Media.
  • Peers.
  • Education.
  • Religion.
  • Faith.
  • Race.
  • Gender.

The family is the first and most effective agent of political socialization

question: A corrupt judicial system erodes the observance of _______
The body responsible for the implementation of law is the _____
explanation: “Executive Government” broadly refers to the arm of government responsible for carrying out or administering laws enacted by the legislature.

question: In a constitutional monarchy, the king or queen is referred to as
explanation: A constitutional monarchy is a form of government in which a non-elected monarch functions as the head of state within the limits of a constitution. The monarch may be the de facto head of state or a purely ceremonial leader.

question: Military intervention into the politics of a state involves ______
explanation: A military government is generally any government that is administrated bymilitary forces, whether this government is legal or not under the laws of the jurisdiction at issue, and whether this government is formed by natives or by an occupying power.
options: an overthrow of a legitimate government by pressure groups
the seizure of power from a legitimate government by the armed forces
violent overthrow of a democratic government by the police
the legitimate seizure of power by the police and civilians

question: Local government are vital in modern politics as they ________
explanation: Local government can play an important role in promoting  training people for governance, job creation and boosting the local economy. By providing good quality cost-effective services and by making the local area a pleasant place to live and work in the municipality will have made a good start to sustainable local economic development.
options: train the local people in the art of governance
make laws for the whole country
execute government policies at all levels

question: Which of the following is a civil/public servant?
explanation: A civil servant or public servant is a person employed in the public sector on behalf of a government department or agency. A civil servant or public servant's first priority is to represent the interests of citizens.

question: In a military regime, the arms of government that are usually fused are _________
A constitution is considered to be flexible if it _______?
explanation: flexible constitution: a constitution that may be amended by the ordinary process of legislation and is therefore relatively easy to amend.
options: can be amended by a simple majority
can be altered through special procedure

question: The principle of checks and balances is important because it
explanation: The system of checks and balances is an important part of the Constitution. With checks and balances, each of the three branches of government can limit the powers of the others. Each branch “checks” the power of the other branches to make sure that the power is balanced between them.
options: prevents each organ of government from being dictatorial
frees other organs from judicial control
makes the government to perform it civic responsibilities

question: Which of the following is a fundamental right? Right to
explanation: The right to life is a moral principle based on the belief that a human being has the right to live and, in particular, should not be killed by another entity including government.

question: Government maintains law and order through the following except ________?
A corrupt judicial system erodes the observance of ______?
explanation: Rule of law is the principle that all people and institutions are subject to and accountable to law that is fairly applied and enforced. A corrupt judicial system will undermine the principle of rule of law and act superior

question: Which of the following statements about public corporation is not true?
explanation:
• Government Owned and financed. 
  • Government Controlled and Managed.
  • Separate Legal Entity. 
  • Perpetual Succession.
  • Autonomy.
  • Service Motive. 
  • Public Accountability.
  • Business Motive.
options: It is managed by a board of directors
It is established by an act of parliament
A huge capital is needed for its establishment
It is financed mainly by private individuals

question: Acceptability of the government in power by the governed is known as
explanation: Legitimacy is the right and acceptance of an authority, usually a governing law or a régime.

question: Which of the following countries practiced totalitarianism?
A function of government is _________
explanation:
Major functions of modern government include
(1) foreign diplomacy
(2) making laws
(3) maintenance of domestic order
(4) administration of justice
(5) protection of civil liberties
(6) provision for and regulation of the conduct of periodic elections
(7) provision for public goods and services
(8) military defense

question: The excessive power of the traditional rulers in the pre-colonial era could checked by ________
The post-Second World War nationalism in West Africa was characterized by
The rights of citizens to benefit from public utility is classified as
explanation: Social rights: the rights to an adequate standard of living, adequate housing, and food; the right to the highest attainable standard of health; the rights to education and social security.

question: Which of the following strengthen the power of the Supreme Court against the executive and the legislature?
Policy of assimilation was successfully operated by the French in
explanation: Assimilation (French colonialism) Assimilation was one ideological basis ofFrench colonial policy in the 19th and 20th centuries. In contrast with British imperialpolicy, the French taught their subjects that, by adopting French language and culture, they could eventually become French. It was succesful in lome

question: The theory of separation of powers was propounded by ________
explanation: This doctrine signifies the fact that one person or body of persons should not exercise all the three powers of the government. The theory of Doctrine of Separation of Power was first propounded by Montesquieu, a French scholar in and 1747 published in his book 'Espirit des Louis' (The spirit of the laws).

question: Which of the following is not a method used by pressure groups to achieve their objectives?
explanation:
The following are some of the methods used by pressure groups to achieve their objectives

  • Demonstration /Protes
  • Work-to rule
  • Strike
  • Boycott 
  • Special Publication 
  • Debates and symposia/workshop
  • Propaganda /Letters to the Press
  • Lobbying
  • Presentation of gift
  • Alliance With political parties and candidates who are perceived to be sumpathelic to their cause.  
  • Sending a delegation
  • Ultimatum

question: Government is defined as an agency established to manage the affairs of _________
explanation: Government is the group of people with the authority to govern a country or state

question: Provision of political education through rallies and newspapers is a function of _________
explanation:
Functions of political parties

  • Mobilize Voters. 
  • Facilitate Governance. 
  • Monitor the Opposing Party in Power.
  • Nominate candidates,
  • raise and spend campaign funds
  • register voters
  • simplify decisions for voters
  • unify diverse interest
  • act as moderating influence on government
  • reduce diffusion of power in government provide patronage
  • inform public through party platforms
  • Agents of political socialization

  •

question: Which system of government has fusion of ceremonial and executive functions as a feature ________
explanation: A presidential system is a democratic and republican system of government where a head of government leads an executive branch that is separate from the legislative branch. This head of government is in most cases also the head of state, which is called president.

question: An agreed set of regulations, conventions and customs by which a country or an organisation is governed is the ________
explanation: A constitution is an aggregate of fundamental principles or established precedents that constitute the legal basis of a polity, organisation or other type of entity, and commonly determine how that entity is to be governed.

question: A system of government which is based on public ownership of means of production and distribution is called
In the pre-colonial era, the breaking of an oath by a chief could _________
options: lead to a war with his neighbours
make his state come under a curse

question: Which of the following is not a feature of a state?
One feature of pre-independence constitutions in West Africa is the
The guiding principle of communism is from each according to his/her
options: ability and to each according to his/her need'
qualification and to each according to his/her need'
race and to each according to his/her ability'
age and to each according to his/ her status

question: The political party whose membership comprises people of high social status is called
For democracy to be sustained in a country it needs a
The electoral system in which the winner should have more than all the votes of all the other contestants put together is called
Colonial administration in West Africa was-a result of
explanation: The purpose of colonization was to serve as a source of inexpensive labor and natural resources.  Most colonists had faced difficult lives in Britain, Ireland, Scotland, or Germany. They came to the Africa to escape poverty, warfare, political turmoil, famine and disease. They believed colonial life offered new opportunities.
options: a need for a new environment
the desire to underdevelop West Africa
a need for raw materials and markets
the urge to introduce western education

question: The Secretary of State for the colonies was responsible for
explanation: He was responsible for the administration of the colonies. One of the functions of the Secretary of State was to advise the British Crown on persons who could be appointed as Governors for the British colonies.
options: fighting for the interest of the people

question: A political party is significant because it _____?
explanation: The presence of the political party is actually a healthy situation for the nation. It gives the people a choice to make a more evolved and effective decision.

question: One primary objective of the New Partnership for African Development (NEPAD) is to
explanation: The New Partnership for Africa's Development (NEPAD) is a socio-economic flagship Programme of the African Union (AU). NEPAD's four primary objectivesare to eradicate poverty, promote sustainable growth and development, integrateAfrica in the world economy and accelerate the empowerment of women.

question: The crown colonies in the British West Africa were administered through _________
explanation: Direct colonial rule is a form of colonialism that involves the establishment of a centralized foreign authority within a territory, which is run by colonial officials.

question: One duty of a good citizen is __________
explanation:
1. Respect and obey federal, state, and local laws.
  2. Respect the rights, beliefs, and opinions of others.
  3. Pay income and other taxes honestly, and on time, to federal, state, and local authorities.
  4. Defend the country if the need should arise.
options: respect of the dignity and rights of others

question: One of the defects associated with most pre-independence constitutions in British West Africa was ________
options: African domination of the executive council
African domination of the legislative council

question: An effective way of strengthening societal institutions is through the expression of ____________
explanation: Public opinion consists of the desires, wants and thinking of the majority of the people. It is the collective opinion of the people of a society or state on an issue or problem. This concept came about through the process of urbanization and other political and social forces.

question: A "Yes" or No" vote on a specific political issue in a country is called ________
explanation: A referendum ; is a direct vote in which an entire electorate is invited to vote on a particular proposal. This may result in the adoption of a new law. In some countries, it is synonymous with a plebiscite or a vote on a ballot question. It could be a ''yes or no''

question: Bicameralism is necessary in a federal state to demonstrate that __________
explanation: In certain variations, a bicameral system may include two parliamentary chambers. The overall purpose behind bicameral legislature is to provide for representation for both the citizens of a country, as well as the state legislatures on the federal level or in the central government of a country or nation.
options: representation in the upper house is base on population
representation of the rich in society is taken care of

question: The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) was formally established in Lagos on _________
explanation: The ECOWAS Treaty (also known as the Treaty of Lagos)established the community when it was signed in Lagos, Nigeria, on May 28, 1975.

question: A political system in which there is only one legalized political party is called a ________
explanation: A one-party state, single-party state, one-party system, or single-party system is a type of state in whichone political party has the right to form the government, usually based on the existing constitution.
